Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Ambient \Am"bi*ent\, a. [L. ambiens, p. pr. of ambire to go around; amb- + ire to go.] Encompassing on all sides; circumfused; investing. ``Ambient air.'' --Milton. ``Ambient clouds.'' --Pope. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Ambient \Am"bi*ent\, n. Something that surrounds or invests; as, air . . . being a perpetual ambient. --Sir H. Wotton. [1913 Webster]
